meanings.definition: To make something sexual or arousing.
meanings.sent1: She tried to eroticise her outfit by adding lace and silk.
meanings.sent2: The artist used vibrant colors to eroticise the painting.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to eroticise the dessert menu with a touch of cinnamon.
meanings.sent4: The music had the power to eroticise the atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent5: The perfume was designed to eroticise the senses of those around.

meanings.definition: To imbue with sexual desire or attraction.
meanings.sent1: He wanted to eroticise their relationship by planning a romantic getaway.
meanings.sent2: The movie was able to eroticise the characters through their intense chemistry.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about trying to eroticise his pet goldfish.
meanings.sent4: The novel managed to eroticise the reader's imagination with its vivid descriptions.
meanings.sent5: The dance performance was meant to eroticise the audience's emotions.
